required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-center Prospective Study Determining the Sustainability of Pain Relief and Psychosocial and Functional Responses When Utilizing a Multiple Waveform Enabled Neurostimulator
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center Prospective Study Determining the Sustainability of Pain Relief and Psychosocial and Functional Responses When Utilizing a Multiple Waveform Enabled Neurostimulator

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate sustainable pain control utilizing a multiple waveform enabled neurostimulator in patients with chronic, intractable pain of the trunk and/or limbs.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate sustainable pain control utilizing the Prodigy or Proclaim Elite family of neurostimulators using a tonic or BurstDR waveform. Subjects will be enrolled prior to their device trial evaluation period. Once the subject has their permanent system implant, they will return to the clinic for follow up visits at 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months post permanent implant.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Post market, international , multicenter, intervention, prospective, single-arm study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pain level as assessed by using the NRS.
primary_outcome.description: Change in pain measured using the Numeric Rating Scale (NRS).

secondary_outcome.description: Change in Quality of Life measured using the EQ5D questionnaire
Change in Pain Catastrophizing measured using the Pain Catastrophizing Scale (PCS).
Change in Anxiety measured using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI).
Change in Depression measured using the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ9).
Change in Fear Avoidance measured using the Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia (TSK).
Change in Sleep measured using the Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Scale.
Change in Physical Function measured using the Patient-Reported Outcome Measure Information System (PROMIS) Physical Function Scale.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Quality of Life measured using the EQ5D questionnaire

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3, 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Pain Catastrophizing measured using the Pain Catastrophizing Scale (PCS).

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Anxiety measured using the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI).

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Depression measured using the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ9).

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 3, 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Fear Avoidance measured using the Tampa Scale of Kinesiophobia (TSK).

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Sleep measured using the Medical Outcome Study (MOS) Sleep Scale.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 12 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Physical Function measured using the Patient-Reported Outcome Measure Information System (PROMIS) Physical Function Scale.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of Trial System Evaluation, 3, 12, 18 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Pain Level measured by using the NRS.

other_outcome.time_frame: End of Trial System Evaluation, 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Patient Satisfaction measured by using standardized questions.

other_outcome.time_frame: End of Trial System Evaluation, 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 Months post-permanent implant.
other_outcome.description: Change in Global Improvement measured by using the Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC).
Change in Pain Medication Usage measured by using a Pain Medication Log.
Stimulation Assessment measured by utilizing the Stimulation Assessment Form

arm_group.description: All subjects enrolled into the study with intent to treat with either a Prodigy, Prodigy MRI, or Proclaim Elite IPG.

intervention.intervention_name: Prodigy, Prodigy MRI or Proclaim Elite IPG
intervention.description: Subjects will be permanently implanted with either a Prodigy, Prodigy MRI or Proclaim Elite IPG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject has chronic, intractable pain of the trunk and/or limbs, including unilateral or bilateral pain associated with the following: failed back surgery syndrome and intractable low back and leg pain.
2. Subject has a score of 6 or higher on the NRS for average pain specific to the area(s) of chronic pain being treated over the past 24 hours at the baseline visit.
3. Subject is considered by the Investigator as a candidate for implantation of a spinal cord stimulator system according to the system Instructions For Use.
4. Subject is 18 years of age or older at the time of enrollment.
5. Subject is willing to cooperate with the study requirements including compliance with the regimen and completion of all study visits.
6. Subject has signed and received a copy of the Ethics Committee/Institutional Review Board (EC/IRB) approved informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject currently has a spinal cord stimulation system implanted.
2. Subject has previously failed SCS therapy (either trial system evaluation or permanent implant).
3. Subject has a primary diagnosis of Peripheral Vascular Disease (PVD), Angina Pectoris, or Chronic Migraine.
4. Subject has or plans to have a Peripheral Nerve Stimulation system (PNS), Peripheral Nerve field Stimulation system (PNfS), Dorsal Root Ganglion system (DRG), or implantable infusion pump.
5. Subject is currently participating in another clinical investigation with an active treatment arm.
6. Subject unable to read and/or write.
